intro: Jacobsenia, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Gesneriaceae. These plants are native to tropical regions of Africa and are characterized by their vibrant, showy flowers. Jacobsenia species typically have succulent leaves and produce small, clustered flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. They are often cultivated as ornamental plants due to their beauty and ease of care. The genus includes several species, with Jacobsenia minor being one of the most widely grown varieties.
